title: What is the most terrifying type of soldier in battle? - Quora

response.answer_text: Assault Troops that are well trained, experienced and well led. As I thought about it, I recognized that SpecOps are also a form of Assault Troops, very different than what most people would consider assault. But, different they are. Your avg SpecOps type goes through a lot of individual training… One ‘‘operator” probably spends more time training with weapons, alone, than an entire rifle squad put together — two squads. Schools galore, best equipment, years in the making and they’re entire orientation is individual, small unit. BTW , I’m sure I’ll regret saying, I don’t consider Rangers as SpecOps. Well trained, light infantry. They were used WWII as assault, and since they’re resurrection during Vietnam, I’m not sure how to classify… they do get some high speed training. It takes a lot of time, energy and money to train SpecOps. Operationally, they’re used in quite a few, different tactical scenarios — raids, hostage, deep area and point reconnaissance, etc……. but they’re not used for conventional assault such as assaulting a company size, and up, prepared position. Losing a squad of “operators” in any situation, that’s like a stock market crash. And no way to recoup your loses. Unfortunately, spent way too much time on a sub-unit type that I wanted to make sure gets mentioned. USMC, during the 40–50–60–70’s, is an example of Assault Troops. Could look at some WWI footage and watch German Stormtroopers for another example. They were awesome. Early 1967 and we went through 5–6 months of extremely hard, difficult training — constantly challenged physically, mentally …. I still remember being told over, and over… 90% of you will be casualties. Our training was focused on offensive combat and the mentality for it. We were trained not to stop for our casualties, best thing we could do is take position so our casualties would be cared for. Our cadence, as we marched, K-I-L-L versus 1,2,3,4. We hardly trained for defensive combat…. “We don’t fight from holes, Army fights from holes”. “We take ground, other people hold it”. I couldn’t help but chuckle some, after re-enlisting, and then being schooled on how to ‘‘construct” a fighting hole…. the right way. I don’t believe they truly understood our mission. My mentors would have rolled in their graves. Assault troops are well trained, fluid, exhibit an elan, confidence and an assurance, as they assault, that conveys to the defenders that they’ll be taking that position — one way or another. And remember that they’re somewhat indoctrinated that they’ll be a casualty, sooner or later. You can’t imagine our ‘‘surprise” when handed our .22 Matels that didn’t work, jamming frequently and beyond anyone’s expectations. I’d hoped someone, someday would put a list together of all of the marine assaults in Northern I Corps. It’d be a very long list. And to accomplish that wo reliable weapons, equipment…… As a defender, I’d be a little concerned. Marine Corps has moved on, over time, which is a shame since they were considered one of the best light infantry assault troops in the world.

I'm going to have to say child soldiers are the most frightening in combat, 8-12 year olds being the worst. These kids are usually drugged up, forced into whatever war their adults place them in, many have been sexually abused. No grown-up soldiers wants to kill children, even if they are trying to kill you. Netflix had an incredible movie called Beasts of No Nations, it was about how a young orphaned boy ends up as a child soldier. Most of the enemies of the free world haved used child soldiers in one capacity or another. A prime example is the unarmed child waves the Iranian military used against the Iraqis during that war. The Iranians used 10-13 year old boys to run forward of the main body to clear mines and other obstacles as well as being ‘human shields' for rhe Iranian military during attacks. The Palestinians have used toddlers straped with explosives and set them against Israeli Soldiers. This happened 100s of times during the Vietnam War. The VC would strap grenades to small children and send them towards the American lines. I would say child soldiers are the most frightening in combat, because even the most combat hardened soldier will end up hesitant to shoot a child soldier.
